title: Love Island Australia: Why Cassie Lansdell turned down The Bachelor
text:
Love Island Australia's Cassie Lansdell has revealed she almost appeared as a contestant on a rival reality TV show.

The London-born beauty, 26, told News.com.au that she was offered a place on The Bachelor but turned producers down at the last minute.

Cassie explained that she made it through the auditions for the Channel 10 dating program but decided it was 'too much drama'.

In demand? Love Island's Cassie Lansdell almost appeared on The Bachelor Australia but pulled out of the show because it seemed like 'too much drama'

She said: 'I got through, but I didn't do it [The Bachelor]. It wasn't really my style. Love Island definitely feels more me.

'I could just tell I wouldn't enjoy it as much. Plus you're competing for one guy and I want options.'

Cassie, who moved to Australia six years ago, did not confirm which season of The Bachelor she had auditioned for, but did say it was 'a couple of years ago'.

New couple alert! Cassie and Luke Packham (pictured with host Sophie Monk) coupled up on Thursday's episode of Love Island Australia

Speaking about the audition process for Love Island Australia, Cassie said it involved an interview with producers and a bikini photo shoot.

But she said it was 'less full-on' than her audition for The Bachelor, which involved potential contestants taking part in bizarre challenges.

In Thursday's recoupling, Cassie split from her previous partner Phoebe Thompson, just days after they had become the show's first same-sex couple.

Following their hearts: Cassie and Phoebe Thompson (pictured) split up this week just days after they had become the show's first same-sex couple

Cassie was chosen by Luke, one half of the Packham twin 'intruders', who had set his sights on the tattooed Brit before even entering the villa.

Initially, both Luke and his brother Josh were attracted to Cassie, but she eventually formed a closer bond with Luke. Josh then decided to pursue Anna McVey instead.

The twins' decisions left both Phoebe and Anna's partner Gerard Majda at risk of elimination after the recoupling ceremony. Following a cast vote, Phoebe was sent home.

Love Island Australia continues Friday at 8.30pm on Channel Nine
description: Love Island Australia's Cassie Lansdell has revealed she almost appeared as a contestant on a rival reality TV show.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
